intro: Sinosophiopsis heishuiensis, commonly known as the Heishui spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
